long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Tab Grouper: Effortless Tab Organization for a Clutter-Free Browser

Tab Grouper is a powerful, easy-to-use Chrome extension that helps you organize and manage your browser tabs with ease. With a single click, it automatically groups your tabs by main domain, instantly creating a clean and organized browsing experience. Our hash algorithm ensures each domain is assigned a consistent color, making it easy to locate tabs at a glance. Simplify your tab management and focus on what matters with Tab Grouper!

Open-Source and Transparent

Tab Grouper is open-source, ensuring that anyone can view, audit, or contribute to its development. We believe in transparency and encourage the community to participate by suggesting improvements or reporting issues. You can explore the code and get involved at: github.com/fabceolin/tabgrouper.

Why Use Tab Grouper?

If you frequently manage multiple tabs, whether for research, development, or multitasking, Tab Grouper simplifies your workflow by organizing tabs based on their content. It reduces the effort needed to find specific tabs, letting you focus on what matters most. The intuitive grouping and visual color coding make navigating through your open tabs quick and easy.

Privacy-Focused

Your privacy is a priority. Tab Grouper operates entirely within your browser and does not transmit data to any servers. Since it's open-source, you can verify that no data collection occurs. This ensures your browsing activity remains private and secure.

Get Involved

We welcome contributions from developers of all skill levels. Visit our GitHub repository to see how you can help enhance Tab Grouper. User feedback is invaluable in guiding future improvements, and we encourage you to share your suggestions.

Support

If you have questions or issues, visit our GitHub page. Weâ€™re committed to providing support and continuously improving the extension based on your feedback. We aim to make your browsing experience efficient and enjoyable with Tab Grouper.
